title: Japan’s GITAI raises $29 million for space robotics business
summary: Japanese space robotics venture GITAI has raised around $29 million to accelerate technology development and its U.S. expansion plans.

title: Missile-warning satellite passes preliminary design review
summary: A U.S. missile-warning satellite completed a major review, keeping the spacecraft on track for launch in 2028.

title: Internet from a small satellite in geostationary orbit? Sure, why not
summary: "We now have a new way of connecting very remote places."

title: Debut Astranis satellite beams first signals to Alaska
summary: The first Astranis-built satellite has reached geostationary orbit over Alaska and completed a key end-to-end payload test following its Falcon Heavy launch at the end of April, the Californian manufacturer announced May 24.

title: First Astranis internet satellite working ‘perfectly’ as company readies to bring coverage to Alaska
summary: Astranis, a San Francisco-based company with an alternative approach to providing internet access from satellites, has its first spacecraft in orbit and the company on Wednesday said it’s working “perfectly.”
